p: This genus is a member of the legume family ( Fabaceae), subfamily Papilionoideae. It comprises at least 120 species most of which are trees and some perennials with large woody roots [ 23]. These species are collectively called “coral trees”, alluding to the flowers, characteristics of the genus, which are commonly bright red [ 24]. The place of origin of the genus Erythrina is not exactly known, but it is suggested that it was probably in South America, since most of the supposed “primitive” groups within the genus are found there. 70 species are recognized in the Neotropics, 38 in Africa and Madagascar, and 12 in Asia and Australia [ 23].
